result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph L. Sampson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 68 days served if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes: ** DEFT IS TO DO 4 MONTHS ON THE KSD WORK CREW.  NOT TO BE PLACED ON THE IRIS PROGRAM UNLESS PERSON HE IS CARING FOR IS AWARE OF HIS CRIMINAL RECORD.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVOKED  -  TIME SERVED.  -  Unpaid financial obligations to be rolled into sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph L. Sampson

time served

Minutes:  14CF1024/15CF341.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros Thaddeus McGuire appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Greg Bates.  Sentencing arguments made.  

14CF1024 - deft sentenced to 195 days KCJ.  Credit for 195 days.  Unpaid financial obligations to be rolled into sentence.

15CF341 - deft fined $600 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 24 days work crew or 24 days KCJ.  

 Appeal rights.
revocation summary & ALJ's decision

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 10-3-17; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  Credit for 68 days served if probation is revoked.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Sentencing set for 6/5/15 @ 11am.  Bond forfeiture hrg is removed from the court's calendar tomorrow.  Bond forfeiture will be addressed at the conclusion of the case.  Deft is to be held w/o bond; bond is revoked.

1:16  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson. Clerk LE.  Warrant vacated. Referred to Br 3 for further disposition on 4-23-15 @ 3:15 further processing. $10,000.00  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  No illegal controlled substances w/ prescription.
961.41(1m)(h)1 Poss w/ Intent to Deliver THC, On or Near a School.
Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Carl Johnson appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Case was scheduled for 11am; case called @ 11:34am.  BW authorized; NO BOND.  Prior bond forfeited.

received from Agent Nunzio Covelli - deft did not report to his scheduled mtg again; Clerk Lema contacted Agent Covelli and requested something in writing from him

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Deft is ordered to keep his appts w/P&P to complete the PSI.  Sentencing set for 3/6/15 @ 11am
received from Agent Covelli - states deft contacted him and stated he had moved.  Agent Covelli informed the deft to appear for his hrg on 2/6/15
from Agent Covelli -stating PSI has not been completed due to deft's lack of cooperation

Agent Nunzio Covelli informed the clerk that he has still been unable to contact def.  Sentencing hearing on 2/6/15 to remain on the calendar, per judge.  Agent to inform the court a few days prior to 2/6/15 as to whether or not he has been able to start the PSI.
received from Agent Covelli - has not made contact w/deft yet regarding PSI.  Deft has not responded to a few letters - agent going out to the house today to attempt to make contact

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2/6/15 @ 11am.
Scheduling Order

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Deft acknowledges receipt of the information; waives the reading.  Plea of not guilty entered to all counts.  FPT 12/10/14 @ 10:30am, JS 1/26/15 @ 9am
Amended bond form signed by def. in courtroom; def. given a copy.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carl Johnson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3.  Information filed.  Arraignment 11/3/14 at 1:15.  Defense motion to modify bond is granted.  Bond modified to $1,000.00 signature w/conditions not to possess or consume alcohol; not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription.
